item.value: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface.
The biggest earthquake ever recorded occurred in Chile, in 1960. Known as the Great Chilean Earthquake, the quake measured 9.5 on the Richter scale.
The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in China.
The Cheetah is the fastest land animal. It can run at 112 kilometres per hour (70 mph). The average person can run from 12 - 17 miles an hour in sprints, so keep away from cheetahs.
Mount McKinley in Alaska in the highest mountain in America. It is 20,320 ft high.
The 1921 Nobel Prize in Physics was won by Albert Einstein for his work in the field of theoretical physics.
The longest recorded flight of a chicken is thirteen seconds
The city with the largest population is Shanghai in China. It has almost 14 million inhabitants.
More than 1,000 different languages are spoken on the continent of Africa.
There are 9 planets that circle the sun. They are divided into two groups: the inner planets (Mercury, Venus,Earth, and Mars) and the outer planets (Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus, Neptune, and Pluto).
The Cambodian alphabet is the world's largest alphabet, with 74 letters.
The moon is 384,400 km from earth. If you travelled to the Moon in a plane it would take about 16 days. It takes 3 days in a spaceship to get there.
About two thirds of the Earth's surface is covered with water.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It is about 38 million kilometers away. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
On average, Elephants sleep for about 2 hours per day.
The blue whale can produce sounds up to 188 decibels. This is the loudest sound produced by a living animal and has been detected as far away as 530 miles.
The tallest person in the world was Robert Wadlow. He was 2.72 meters ( 8ft 11in ) tall.
The shortfin Mako shark is the fastest fish, it can swim at 50 kilometres per hour. Olympic gold-medal swimmers could not escape even if they tried, they can only swim at 8 kph (5 mph) .
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. The second largest animal is the Afican elephant.
The most widely spoken language is Mandarin, nearly 1 billion people speak it, mainly in northern and south-western China. English is the second most spoken language in the world.
